text: Router-First Protocol: All requests go through Router agent for classification before spawning specialized agents
Parallel tool use significantly speeds up exploration - use multiple Task calls in single message
Use platform-aware constants from .claude/lib/platform.cjs for cross-platform shell commands
Dual-layer memory: File-based (always works) + graph/vector DB (semantic search when available)
Session-based storage with read-time truncation prevents unbounded context growth
Creator ecosystem: agent-creator, skill-creator, hook-creator, workflow-creator, template-creator, schema-creator
BLOCKING validation before creating artifacts - check for duplicates, conflicts, missing dependencies
context_strategy in agent YAML: minimal (router), lazy_load (default), full (deep analysis)
Load memory with node .claude/lib/memory/memory-manager.cjs load instead of reading learnings.md directly

Router-First Hard Guardrails: CLAUDE.md Section 1.1 (ROUTER WHITELIST/BLACKLIST) and Section 1.2 (SELF-CHECK PROTOCOL) enforce Router tool restrictions. Router may ONLY use Task, TaskList, TaskCreate, TaskUpdate, TaskGet, Read (agent defs only), AskUserQuestion. Router MUST NOT use Edit, Write, Bash (implementation), Glob, Grep, WebSearch, mcp__*. Section 6 now titled ROUTER IRON LAWS with explicit violation detection.

Created external-integration workflow at .claude/workflows/core/external-integration.md - A comprehensive 9-phase workflow for safely integrating external artifacts (GitHub repos, skills, agents, workflows, templates, hooks) into the framework. Key features: isolation-first approach (temp directory), parallel expert reviews (architect + security), BLOCKING validation gates, automatic rollback procedures, and mandatory CLAUDE.md updates. Updated CLAUDE.md Section 8.6 with workflow entry.

Updated creator-registry.json with 2 missing core workflows (router-decision, external-integration). Registry totalWorkflows now matches actual count (13). Also added workflowToAgents relationships for new workflows.

Agent YAML Frontmatter Standard: Field order is name, version, description, model, temperature, context_strategy, priority, extended_thinking (optional), tools, skills. All 39 agents use version: 1.0.0.
Session creation requires SessionEnd hook in settings.json to call saveSession() with session insights
SessionEnd hook: Use stdin JSON parsing with fallback to active_context.md for session data extraction
TDD for hooks: Write tests first, verify RED, implement to GREEN, then register in settings.json

Integration tests for hooks: Use resetState() to reset router-state.json before each test, use execSync with stdin for passing hook input, verify exit codes (0=allow, 2=block). Test the chicken-egg scenario by verifying PLANNER can break the cycle. Full flow tests verify UserPromptSubmit -> complexity detection -> Task blocking.
